segment.source: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Server
segment.target: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Server

segment.source: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Server
segment.target: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Server

segment.source: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Server
segment.target: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Server

segment.source: You can install the App-V 5.0 server features by using different deployment configurations, which described in this topic.
segment.target: You can install the App-V 5.0 server features by using different deployment configurations, which described in this topic.

segment.source: Before you install the server features, review the server section of App-V 5.0 Security Considerations.
segment.target: Before you install the server features, review the server section of App-V 5.0 Security Considerations.

segment.source: For information about deploying the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server, see About App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: For information about deploying the App-V 5.0 SP3 Server, see About App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Before you install and configure the App-V 5.0 servers, you must specify a port where each component will be hosted.
segment.target: Before you install and configure the App-V 5.0 servers, you must specify a port where each component will be hosted.

segment.source: You must also add the associated firewall rules to allow incoming requests to access the specified ports.
segment.target: You must also add the associated firewall rules to allow incoming requests to access the specified ports.

segment.source: The installer does not modify firewall settings.
segment.target: The installer does not modify firewall settings.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Server overview
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Server overview

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 Server is made up of five components.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 Server is made up of five components.

segment.source: Each component serves a different purpose within the App-V 5.0 environment.
segment.target: Each component serves a different purpose within the App-V 5.0 environment.

segment.source: Each of the five components is briefly described here:
segment.target: Each of the five components is briefly described here:

segment.source: Management Server – provides overall management functionality for the App-V 5.0 infrastructure.
segment.target: Management Server – provides overall management functionality for the App-V 5.0 infrastructure.

segment.source: Management Database – facilitates database predeployments for App-V 5.0 management.
segment.target: Management Database – facilitates database predeployments for App-V 5.0 management.

segment.source: Publishing Server – provides hosting and streaming functionality for virtual applications.
segment.target: Publishing Server – provides hosting and streaming functionality for virtual applications.

segment.source: Reporting Server – provides App-V 5.0 reporting services.
segment.target: Reporting Server – provides App-V 5.0 reporting services.

segment.source: Reporting Database – facilitates database predeployments for App-V 5.0 reporting.
segment.target: Reporting Database – facilitates database predeployments for App-V 5.0 reporting.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 stand-alone deployment
segment.target: App-V 5.0 stand-alone deployment

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 standalone deployment provides a good topology for a small deployment or a test environment.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 standalone deployment provides a good topology for a small deployment or a test environment.

segment.source: When you use this type of implementation, all server components are deployed to a single computer.
segment.target: When you use this type of implementation, all server components are deployed to a single computer.

segment.source: The services and associated databases will compete for the resources on the computer that runs the App-V 5.0 components.
segment.target: The services and associated databases will compete for the resources on the computer that runs the App-V 5.0 components.

segment.source: Therefore, you should not use this topology for larger deployments.
segment.target: Therefore, you should not use this topology for larger deployments.

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V 5.0 Server
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V 5.0 Server

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V 5.0 Server Using a Script
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V 5.0 Server Using a Script

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Server distributed deployment
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Server distributed deployment

segment.source: The distributed deployment topology can support a large App-V 5.0 client base and it allows you to more easily manage and scale your environment.
segment.target: The distributed deployment topology can support a large App-V 5.0 client base and it allows you to more easily manage and scale your environment.

segment.source: When you use this type of deployment, the App-V 5.0 Server components are deployed across multiple computers, based on the structure and requirements of the organization.
segment.target: When you use this type of deployment, the App-V 5.0 Server components are deployed across multiple computers, based on the structure and requirements of the organization.

segment.source: How to Install the Management and Reporting Databases on Separate Computers from the Management and Reporting Services
segment.target: How to Install the Management and Reporting Databases on Separate Computers from the Management and Reporting Services

segment.source: How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database
segment.target: How to install the Reporting Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V 5.0 Server Using a Script
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V 5.0 Server Using a Script

segment.source: How to Install the Publishing Server on a Remote Computer
segment.target: How to Install the Publishing Server on a Remote Computer

segment.source: How to install the Management Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database
segment.target: How to install the Management Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database

segment.source: Using an Enterprise Software Distribution (ESD) solution and App-V 5.0
segment.target: Using an Enterprise Software Distribution (ESD) solution and App-V 5.0

segment.source: You can also deploy the App-V 5.0 clients and packages by using an ESD without having to deploy App-V 5.0.
segment.target: You can also deploy the App-V 5.0 clients and packages by using an ESD without having to deploy App-V 5.0.

segment.source: The full capabilities for integration will vary depending on the ESD that you use.
segment.target: The full capabilities for integration will vary depending on the ESD that you use.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 reporting server and reporting database can still be deployed alongside the ESD to collect the reporting data from the App-V 5.0 clients.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 reporting server and reporting database can still be deployed alongside the ESD to collect the reporting data from the App-V 5.0 clients.

segment.source: However, the other three server components should not be deployed, because they will conflict with the ESD functionality.
segment.target: However, the other three server components should not be deployed, because they will conflict with the ESD functionality.

segment.source: Deploying App-V 5.0 Packages by Using Electronic Software Distribution (ESD)
segment.target: Deploying App-V 5.0 Packages by Using Electronic Software Distribution (ESD)

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Server logs
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Server logs

segment.source: You can use App-V 5.0 server log information to help troubleshoot the server installation and operational events while using App-V 5.0.
segment.target: You can use App-V 5.0 server log information to help troubleshoot the server installation and operational events while using App-V 5.0.

segment.source: The server-related log information can be reviewed with the Event Viewer.
segment.target: The server-related log information can be reviewed with the Event Viewer.

segment.source: The following line displays the specific path for Server-related events:
segment.target: The following line displays the specific path for Server-related events:

segment.source: Event Viewer Applications and Services Logs Microsoft App V
segment.target: Event Viewer Applications and Services Logs Microsoft App V

segment.source: Associated setup logs are saved in the following directory:
segment.target: Associated setup logs are saved in the following directory:

segment.source: %temp%
segment.target: %temp%

segment.source: In App-V 5.0 SP3, some logs have been consolidated and moved.
segment.target: In App-V 5.0 SP3, some logs have been consolidated and moved.

segment.source: See About App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: See About App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 reporting
segment.target: App-V 5.0 reporting

segment.source: App-V 5.0 reporting allows App-V 5.0 clients to collect data and then send it back to be stored in a central repository.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 reporting allows App-V 5.0 clients to collect data and then send it back to be stored in a central repository.

segment.source: You can use this information to get a better view of the virtual application usage within your organization.
segment.target: You can use this information to get a better view of the virtual application usage within your organization.

segment.source: The following list displays some of the types of information the App-V 5.0 client collects:
segment.target: The following list displays some of the types of information the App-V 5.0 client collects:

segment.source: Information about the computer that runs the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: Information about the computer that runs the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: Information about virtualized packages on a specific computer that runs the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: Information about virtualized packages on a specific computer that runs the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: Information about package open and shutdown for a specific user.
segment.target: Information about package open and shutdown for a specific user.

segment.source: The reporting information will be maintained until it is successfully sent to the reporting server database.
segment.target: The reporting information will be maintained until it is successfully sent to the reporting server database.

segment.source: After the data is in the database, you can use Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services to generate any necessary reports.
segment.target: After the data is in the database, you can use Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services to generate any necessary reports.

segment.source: If you want to retrieve report information, you must use Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) which is available with Microsoft SQL.
segment.target: If you want to retrieve report information, you must use Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) which is available with Microsoft SQL.

segment.source: SSRS is not installed when you install the App-V 5.0 reporting server and it must be deployed separately to generate the associated reports.
segment.target: SSRS is not installed when you install the App-V 5.0 reporting server and it must be deployed separately to generate the associated reports.

segment.source: Use the following link for more information About App-V 5.0 Reporting.
segment.target: Use the following link for more information About App-V 5.0 Reporting.

segment.source: How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell
